summary: Implement admin panel authentication flow to replace immediate 'Access Denied' with a password login modal, persist session via localStorage, and provide logout.
architectural_notes: Use localStorage key `isAdmin` to persist admin session; on page load show dashboard if `isAdmin==='true'` else show login modal.
Authentication is client-side with a hardcoded password string (security risk); intended only for lightweight gating.
known_issues: Admin Panel currently shows 'Access Denied' and blocks login (urgent).

existing_features.title: Change the Admin Panel access UX so clicking the "Admin Panel" tab never immediately shows an "Access Denied" screen; instead, it must immediately open a popup/modal that asks the user to enter an admin password.

Implement client-side admin authentication using the exact password string "@ni#ra&j*gurja:r" and store the session flag using localStorage.setItem('isAdmin','true') on successful login; if the password is incorrect, show an alert with the exact text "Wrong Password!".
Add persistence on page load for the Admin Panel: if localStorage 'isAdmin' is the string 'true', show the Admin Panel dashboard directly; otherwise show the login modal.

After successful login, reveal the Admin Panel dashboard actions (including "Job Posts", "Quiz", and "Settings") and add a small "Logout" button in the top-right of the Admin Panel that clears the admin session by removing/resetting localStorage 'isAdmin' and returns the Admin Panel to the locked state (login modal shown on next view).

new_feature_requests.summary: Admin Panel login modal: prompt for admin password instead of showing 'Access Denied', validate against specified password, set localStorage isAdmin=true on success, show dashboard options, alert on wrong password, persist on page load, and add Logout to clear session.

projectName: Fix Admin Panel access flow with password login modal, localStorage persistence, and logout
